comments:
Build ID: 3.2.1 Build id: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1. create an xmi file as UML 1.x version
2. attempt to create an EMF project importing the UML
3. Browse to the XMI file and LOAD it.


More information:
After Loading the xmi, the UML import wizard does not enable the NEXT and FINISH buttions, but does not issue an error either.  User has no idea what the problem is.

XMI file was generated by Enterprise Architect.
Created an attachment (id=57951)
XMI file exported by Enterprise Architect as UML 2.1

This xmi is exported by Enterprise Architect.  I selected the UML 2.1 option for the export, so we might have an EA issue if the output is not correct.
Just tried this with UML2.1. (EMF2.3) (Eclipse 3.3.0)

Firstly, the wizard only accepts items with .uml2, .uml, or .xmi extenstions.  The attachment provided has a .xml extension.   Upon renaming this to .xmi, an error dialog does appear complaining about content which seems sufficient.

The file in question seems to be malformed.  Please refer to the defect below for further explanations but there does appear to be an error dialog already displayed to the user.  Please upgrade to 2.1 and retry.

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=173137

(In reply to comment #2)
> Please upgrade to 2.1 and retry.

Besides Eclipse 3.3 + UML 2.1 do I need other plugins to test this?  The build requirements list others, but are these only build requirments, or runtime also?



Created an attachment (id=58781)
XMI file exported by Enterprise Architect as UML 2.1 

Retested with UML 2.1 as requested.  Using the new attachment with Eclipse 3.3, EMF 2.3 and UML 2.1 I now get an error message indicating an exception.  Error log entry follows.

FWIW, the error log entry is flagged as a warning or info (yield sign w/ "!") but this type of exception seems like an error to me.

Michael
